holidays.name: Pet Theft Awareness Day
holidays.description: A day to raise awareness about the rising problem of pet theft and to encourage pet owners to take steps to protect their furry friends.
holidays.origin: Started in the UK by animal welfare groups to spotlight the growing issue of pet thefts and illegal pet sales.
holidays.funFact: Pet theft rates tend to spike around Valentine's Day, making mid-February crucial for pet safety vigilance.

holidays.name: Battery Day (Not Tesla's)
holidays.description: A quirky salute to the humble battery, celebrating the invention that powers our gadgets and keeps our world ticking.
holidays.origin: Informally recognized by tech enthusiasts to appreciate battery technology innovation, not to be confused with commercial 'Battery Day' events.
holidays.funFact: The first electrochemical battery, the Voltaic Pile, was invented in 1800 by Alessandro Volta ‚Äî the 'volt' is named after him!

holidays.name: National Drink Wine Day (Unofficial)
holidays.description: A perfect reason to swirl, sip, and savor your favorite wine varietal with friends or solo indulgence.
holidays.origin: An informal food and drink holiday celebrated primarily on social media by wine lovers around the world.
holidays.funFact: Despite its name, the biggest consumption of wine on this day happens in the US, not traditional wine-producing countries.

holidays.name: World Pangolin Day (Second Saturday of February, but sometimes observed around this date)
holidays.description: A day dedicated to celebrating and protecting the pangolin, the world's most trafficked mammal, known for its unique scaly armor.
holidays.origin: Created by conservation groups to spotlight pangolin conservation efforts globally.
holidays.funFact: Pangolins are the only mammals wholly covered in scales, which they use like armor to protect themselves from predators.
